ComplexSynapse Class Reference

Inheritance diagram for ComplexSynapse:

List of all members.

Detailed Description

A synapse.

This class implements a synapse which is characterized by a differential equation. Main feature is the transformation of digital signals from an Event object (usually a neuron) to analog values of a Stochastic object, which then are part of the membrane equation of another neuron. It also possible to use a noise source (such as a Wiener process) as input. This depends on the constructor you use. Since a synapse usually connects from one single neuron to another single neuron, this class is set to be active as default, i.e. is forwarded automatically and you don't have to use step() and next() inside your program.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

ComplexSynapse::ComplexSynapse ( const Time *  time,
Event *  e,
double  weight,
double  revPot,
double  peak,
double  tau 
)

Construct.

Parameters:
e The object providing the events (spikes), i.e. the pre-synaptic neuron.
peak The synapse's peak conductance.
tau The decay time constant.
time The time (object pointer). This will construct a synapse, which will set its value to the peak conductance just after the pre-synaptic spike, and decay the value according to the given time constant. At the next pre-synaptic spike the value will be set to the peak conductance again.

ComplexSynapse::ComplexSynapse ( const Time *  time,
StochVariable *  s,
double  weight,
double  revPot,
double  tau 
)

Construct.

Parameters:
s The object providing the noise input (spikes), i.e. the pre-synaptic stimulus noise.
peak The synapse's peak conductance.
tau The decay time constant.
time The time (object pointer). This will construct a synapse, which will set its value to the peak conductance just after the pre-synaptic spike, and decay the value according to the given time constant. At the next pre-synaptic spike the value will be set to the peak conductance again.
